Urban Chinatown

About Data Collection + Mapping Precedent Studies Contact

About

As part of a Architecture Studio at the University of British Columbia, this site is intended to document our exploration of Vancouver's Chinatown District. This site will be updated throughout the course of 2015 analyizing various aspects of Chinatown for the intent of proposing housing strategies within the area. More information about collaborators can be found here.


Data Collection and Mapping

Our first assignment addressed researching the various physical aspects that exist within Chinatown.


Streetscapes

Analyzing the street through symbology and section

Lane Networks

Exploring the hidden spaces and networks

Green Ways and Spaces

Tradition + Typologies

Wallscapes

A study of the facades, materials, and storefronts

Roofscapes

Examining the character of the building rooflines

Connection to City

An analysis of Chinatown’s undefined boundaries

Precedent Studies

Our second assignment looked at various housing types from different regions of the world. These precedents were grouped into three types based on geometric organization. The Donut, The Sponge and the Ad Hoc were the 3 spatial types we examined.


The Donut

La Corte Verde

Cino Zucchi Architetti

Inakasa Building

Alexis López Acosta

Ad Hoc

Sarugaku

Akihisa Hirata
